EditContextUpdateCharacterBounds.summary: The EditContext.updateCharacterBounds() method of the interface should be called as response to a event to inform the operating system about the position and size of the characters in the EditContext object.

remarks.para: The characterboundsupdate event is the only time you need to call the updateCharacterBounds() method.

The character bounds information is then used by the operating system to correctly position the Input Method Editor (IME) window when needed. This is especially important in situations where the operating system can't automatically detect the position and size of the characters, such as when rendering text in a <canvas> element.
